definitions: lawyer authorized to act on behalf of clients in legal matters
examples: The defense attorney presented compelling evidence to the jury
She hired an attorney to handle her divorce proceedings

definitions: quality or feature that draws interest or creates appeal
place or event that draws visitors for entertainment or interest
force that draws objects together, especially in physics
examples: The main attraction of the job was its flexible schedule
Her natural charm was an immediate attraction to everyone
The new roller coaster became the park's biggest attraction
They visited several tourist attractions during their vacation
Gravitational attraction keeps planets in orbit around the sun
The magnetic attraction between the particles was measurable

definitions: distinguishing quality or characteristic belonging to someone or something
property or value assigned to an object in computing or data
examples: Patience is an essential attribute for teachers
The product's best attribute is its durability
Each database record contains multiple attributes like name and address
The programmer modified the attribute values in the code

definitions: act of assigning a cause, quality, or source to something
acknowledgment of the source or creator of a work or idea
examples: The attribution of blame proved difficult without clear evidence
Scientists debated the attribution of climate changes to human activity
Proper attribution is required when using copyrighted images
The article lacked attribution for several quoted sources

definitions: gradual reduction in workforce through resignation, retirement, or death
process of gradually wearing down through friction or erosion
examples: The company reduced staff through natural attrition rather than layoffs
Student attrition rates increased during the pandemic
Coastal attrition threatens beachfront properties every year
The attrition of the rock face occurred over millennia

definitions: public sale where items are sold to the highest bidder
examples: The rare painting sold for millions at the auction
They attended an online auction for vintage furniture

definitions: person who conducts auctions by accepting bids and declaring sales
examples: The auctioneer spoke rapidly as bids increased
An experienced auctioneer can significantly increase final sale prices

definitions: willingness to take bold risks or show disrespectful boldness
examples: She had the audacity to question the CEO's decision publicly
His audacity in attempting the impossible inspired others

definitions: quality of being loud or clear enough to be heard
examples: Her voice was barely audible over the crowd noise
The speaker made sure every word was clearly audible

definitions: group of people gathered to watch or listen to a performance
intended recipients or consumers of media content or communication
formal meeting with an important person, especially royalty or religious leader
examples: The audience gave a standing ovation after the performance
The comedian quickly won over the skeptical audience
The show targets a younger audience demographic
Writers must consider their intended audience when choosing vocabulary
The pope granted them a private audience at the Vatican
She requested an audience with the company president

definitions: recorded or transmitted sound, especially as distinct from video
equipment or technology related to recording or reproducing sound
examples: The audio quality of the podcast was excellent
They synchronized the audio with the video footage
Professional audio equipment filled the recording studio
The technician adjusted the audio settings for optimal sound

definitions: relating to or using both sight and sound, typically in education or presentation
examples: The presentation included various audiovisual materials
Modern classrooms require advanced audiovisual equipment

definitions: official examination and verification of financial accounts and records
systematic review or assessment of any process or system
examples: The annual audit revealed no accounting irregularities
External auditors examined the company's financial statements
They conducted a safety audit of all manufacturing facilities
The energy audit identified several efficiency improvements

definitions: trial performance to test suitability for a role or position in entertainment
examples: She prepared extensively for her audition at the theater company
Hundreds of actors attended the open audition for the new film

definitions: professional who examines and verifies financial accounts and records
person who attends a course without receiving academic credit
examples: The auditor discovered discrepancies in the expense reports
Independent auditors certified the company's financial statements
Several auditors attended the lecture without enrolling formally
University policy allows senior citizens to be auditors free

definitions: large room or building used for public gatherings, performances, or presentations
examples: The school auditorium seats over eight hundred people
They held the graduation ceremony in the main auditorium

definitions: process of making something greater by adding to it
surgical procedure to enhance or enlarge a body part
examples: The augmentation of staff helped meet increased demand
Data augmentation improved the machine learning model's performance
Breast augmentation remains one of the most common cosmetic surgeries
The surgeon discussed various augmentation options with the patient

definitions: sister of one's parent or wife of one's uncle
examples: My aunt always sends birthday cards to all her nieces
She visited her favorite aunt during summer vacation

definitions: informal or affectionate term for aunt or older female friend
examples: The children call her Auntie Sarah even though she's not related
Auntie always brings the best presents at Christmas

definitions: alternative spelling of auntie, informal term for aunt
examples: Aunty Mary taught me how to bake cookies
All the neighborhood kids called her Aunty

definitions: distinctive atmosphere or quality that surrounds a person or thing
supposed energy field surrounding living beings in spiritual beliefs
sensation preceding a migraine or seizure episode
examples: She carried an aura of confidence into every room
The old mansion had an aura of mystery about it
Some claim to see colorful auras around people
The healer said my aura needed cleansing
The visual aura warned him a migraine was coming
Seizure auras can include strange smells or sensations

definitions: natural light display in polar skies caused by solar particles
Roman goddess of dawn in classical mythology
examples: The aurora borealis painted green curtains across the northern sky
Tourists travel to Alaska to witness the spectacular aurora
Aurora was depicted driving her chariot across the sky
The poet invoked Aurora to describe the morning light

definitions: sternness or severity of manner, attitude, or appearance lacking comfort
difficult economic conditions created by government measures to reduce spending
examples: The monastery practiced austerity in all aspects of daily life
Her austerity of dress reflected her serious nature
Government austerity measures led to widespread protests
The country endured years of economic austerity after the crisis

definitions: film director regarded as the primary creative force behind a movie
examples: Critics consider him an auteur with a distinctive visual style
The festival celebrates auteur cinema from around the world

definitions: process of proving or verifying the identity or validity of something
examples: Two-factor authentication adds extra security to online accounts
The museum required authentication before purchasing the artifact

definitions: quality of being genuine, real, or true to one's own character
examples: Experts confirmed the authenticity of the ancient manuscript
She valued authenticity over popularity in her relationships

definitions: person who writes books, articles, or other written works
person who creates or originates something, especially an idea or plan
examples: The author signed copies of her latest novel
Several authors contributed chapters to the anthology
She was the author of the new company policy
The senator authored legislation on healthcare reform

definitions: official permission or approval to do something, British spelling
examples: She received authorisation to access classified documents
The project cannot proceed without proper authorisation

definitions: person or system favoring strict obedience to authority at expense of freedom
examples: The authoritarian leader suppressed all political opposition
Critics called the new policies authoritarian and undemocratic

definitions: political system based on submission to authority and limited individual freedom
examples: The country slid toward authoritarianism after the military coup
Scholars study how democracies can resist authoritarianism

definitions: power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience
person with extensive knowledge or expertise in a particular area
governmental or administrative organization with specific responsibilities
examples: The manager has authority to approve budgets under fifty thousand
Parents struggle to maintain authority with teenage children
She's a leading authority on Renaissance art history
The professor is an authority on constitutional law
The housing authority manages public apartment buildings
Local authorities issued flood warnings to residents

definitions: official permission or approval to do something, American spelling
examples: The doctor needs insurance authorization before surgery
Security clearance requires high-level authorization

definitions: origin or creation of a written work or the state of being an author
examples: Scholars debate the authorship of several Shakespeare plays
She takes pride in the authorship of three novels

definitions: developmental disorder affecting communication, social interaction, and behavior patterns
examples: Early intervention helps children with autism develop communication skills
The autism spectrum includes a wide range of abilities

definitions: informal term for automobile or car
examples: The auto industry faces challenges from electric vehicles
He works at an auto repair shop downtown

definitions: account of a person's life written by that person themselves
examples: The celebrity's autobiography became an instant bestseller
She spent years writing her autobiography after retirement

definitions: system of government where one person has absolute power
examples: The revolution ended decades of autocracy in the nation
Critics warned that emergency powers could lead to autocracy

definitions: ruler who has absolute power over a country or organization
examples: The autocrat ruled the nation with an iron fist
History remembers him as a benevolent autocrat

definitions: person's signature, especially of a celebrity written for an admirer
manuscript or document written in the author's own handwriting
examples: Fans waited hours to get the singer's autograph
The athlete signed autographs after the game
The museum displayed the autograph manuscript of the famous poem
Collectors value autograph letters from historical figures

definitions: condition where the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own healthy tissues
examples: Autoimmunity causes the body to attack its own cells
Researchers study genetic factors contributing to autoimmunity

definitions: company that manufactures automobiles
examples: Major automakers announced plans for electric vehicle production
The automaker recalled thousands of vehicles for safety issues

definitions: machine or device that operates by itself without human control
firearm that continues firing while the trigger is pressed
examples: The automatic opens the garage door when you approach
She drives an automatic rather than a manual transmission
The military uses automatics for sustained firepower
Ownership of automatics requires special licensing

definitions: use of automatic equipment and systems to replace human labor in production
examples: Factory automation eliminated many manufacturing jobs
Home automation systems control lighting and temperature remotely

definitions: self-operating machine or robot that performs predetermined actions
person who acts in a mechanical or unemotional manner
examples: The clockwork automaton amazed eighteenth-century audiences
Modern automatons can perform complex manufacturing tasks
He moved through his daily routine like an automaton
Office workers felt like automatons in the repetitive job

definitions: four-wheeled motor vehicle designed for passenger transportation on roads
examples: The automobile revolutionized transportation in the twentieth century
She purchased her first automobile after graduating college

definitions: right or condition of self-government for a region or organization
freedom to make one's own decisions without external control
examples: The region gained autonomy after years of negotiations
Universities traditionally enjoy considerable autonomy from government
Teenagers seek greater autonomy from their parents
Patient autonomy is a fundamental principle in medical ethics

definitions: system that automatically controls an aircraft or ship without constant human intervention
state of acting without conscious thought through routine or habit
examples: The pilot engaged the autopilot during the long flight
Modern autopilot systems can land planes in poor visibility
She drove home on autopilot after the exhausting shift
He went through the presentation on autopilot

definitions: examination of a dead body to determine the cause of death
examples: The autopsy revealed poison in the victim's system
Medical examiners perform autopsies in suspicious death cases

definitions: season between summer and winter when leaves fall from trees
examples: The leaves turn brilliant colors during autumn
They planned their wedding for early autumn

definitions: person or thing providing supplementary or additional help and support
backup equipment or system used when the main one fails
examples: Nursing auxiliaries assist qualified nurses with patient care
The organization relies on auxiliaries for fundraising events
The auxiliary generator kicked in during the power outage
Ships carry auxiliary engines in case of main engine failure
